eligibility_criteria.description:
Minimum age: 40 Years
Maximum age: 60 Years
This trial does not accept healthy volunteers.
Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) =< 2.5 x ULN, or =< 5 x ULN if liver metastases are present
Patients must provide verbal and written informed consent to participate in the study
Pathologic evidence of Small Cell Lung Cancer, or Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.
Patients must have, or have previously had, stage I (T1NO) or stage II (T2NO) squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck
Prior head and neck radiation or prior chemotherapy

Patients who have received allogeneic stem cell transplant and do not have active
             graft vs host disease requiring immunosuppressive therapy are eligible
Willing to provide access to medical records, insurance and billing data, biospecimens and respond to questionnaires, typically by phone, but possibly to include online or in-person surveys

All herbal, alternative and food supplements (i.e. PC-Spes, saw palmetto, St. Johns wort, etc.) must be discontinued before registration; patients may continue on a daily multi-vitamin, calcium and vitamin D

Before starting study treatment, patients must have recovered from toxic effects of prior therapies and at least 2 weeks must have elapsed since any other prior signaling pathway modulators, (e.g., PI3K/AKT inhibitors including but not limited to BKM120, mTOR inhibitors including but not limited to rapalogs, or growth factor receptor inhibitors including but not limited to crizotinib or imatinib); at least 4 weeks must have elapsed since any other prior anti-cancer therapy (e.g., temozolomide, carboplatin), except: at least 6 weeks from nitrosoureas (e.g., carmustine [BCNU], lomustine [CCNU]); any question should be addressed to the sponsor

groups.description:
PART I: Patients undergo 3-Tesla whole body MRI/PET scan.

PART II: Patients with asymptomatic myeloma undergo 1.5-Tesla MRI of the pelvis and bilateral femora with new sequences.

groups.name: Diagnostic (3-Tesla MRI/PET scan)

groups.description: Patients receive cyclophosphamide IV on days -7 to -2 (cohorts 2-4 only) and then receive mesothelin-specific chimeric antigen receptor-engineered peripheral blood lymphocytes intrapleurally over 1-2 hours on day 0. Patients who experience unacceptable toxicity that is probably or likely related to mesothelin-specific chimeric antigen receptor-engineered peripheral blood lymphocytes may receive dimerizer AP1903 IV to mediate clearance of the genetically engineered cells and resolve toxicity.

interventions.name: Mesothelin-specific Chimeric Antigen Receptor-engineered Peripheral Blood Lymphocytes
Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material

groups.name: Treatment (mesothelin-specific engineered T-cells)

outcome_measures.analysis_method: Unacceptable toxicity will be defined as treatment-related mortality and Grade 3 or 4 non-hematological toxicity, with the specific exceptions of the following Grade 3 toxicities: anorexia, weight loss, nausea, fatigue, mucositis, diarrhea, fever, electrolyte/metabolic abnormalities, and infection. Each of these adverse events will be monitored separately. A true rate of 1% for the entire treatment period is considered acceptable, whereas a rate of 5.5% would not be.
outcome_measures.measure: Toxicity as assessed by the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0

outcome_measures.analysis_method: The area under the curve (AUC0→infinity), half-life (t 1/2), and maximum concentration (Cmax) for everolimus will be determined by noncompartmental analysis.
outcome_measures.measure: Pharmacokinetic profile of daily everolimus among patients with PEG tubes
outcome_measures.time_frame: On the first day that everolimus is administered at 0, 15, 30, and 60 minutes and 2, 3, 4.5, 6, and 8 hours

outcome_measures.analysis_method: Progression, for those patients showing an initial decline in PSA from baseline is defined as an increase in PSA that is >= 25% and >= 2 ng/mL above the nadir, and which is confirmed by a second value 3 or more weeks later (i.e., a confirmed rising trend).
outcome_measures.measure: Progression, for those patients showing an initial decline in PSA from baseline

outcome_measures.analysis_method: The rate of rPFS at 6 months and median time to rPFS will be estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome_measures.time_frame: Time from study entry or random assignment to disease progression in bone or soft-tissue, symptoms, or death, assessed at 6 months
